newsitem.title: USA: Coca-Cola Enterprises sees Q1 charge.
newsitem.headline: Coca-Cola Enterprises sees Q1 charge.

text.p: Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc said Tuesday its first-quarter 1997 results will include a one-time charge associated with debt redemption of about $6 million, or $0.3 per common share after tax, based on shares outstanding prior to a proposed three-for-one stock split.
Coca-Cola Enterprises also said that effective April 1 it redeemed all of its outstanding 8-3/4 percent debentures due April 1, 2017.
The company said it had about $142 million outstanding under this debt issue.
The company said it already refinanced this debt issue with lower cost debt, enhancing the company's long-term debt portfolio.
The company said first-quarter 1997 noncash expenses related to certain stock-based compensation plans will be higher than the company's original 1997 expectations.
The company said its stock price increased as much as 36 percent during the first quarter of 1997 and ended the quarter up about 25 percent.

This growth in market value, along with the company's outlook for strong full-year 1997 performance, will result in higher stock-related selling, general and administrative (SG&A) expenses, primarily noncash amortization expenses, the company said.

While SG&A expenses will be higher than originally anticipated due to the company's strong first-quarter 1997 stock price performance, it said it continues to expect full-year 1997 comparable cash operating profit growth of nine percent, which should generate 1997 earnings per share growth of 10 percent to 15 percent above 1996 adjusted earnings of $0.80 per share.
